intro: Calcaratolobelia tenella, commonly known as the slender lobelia, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of South Africa. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its small, delicate blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rocky crevices or forest understories. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often covered in a fine layer of hair. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
